meanings.definition: To move from one place to another
meanings.sent1: Birds transmigrate south for the winter.
meanings.sent2: The family decided to transmigrate to a new city for better opportunities.
meanings.sent3: The ants seemed to transmigrate to the kitchen every summer, looking for crumbs.
meanings.sent4: The clouds transmigrate across the sky, changing shapes as they move.
meanings.sent5: The river seemed to transmigrate endlessly, flowing from one place to another.

meanings.definition: To pass into another body after death
meanings.sent1: In some beliefs, it is said that souls transmigrate into different beings.
meanings.sent2: The ancient legend tells of a spirit that can transmigrate into any living creature.
meanings.sent3: The ghost joked that it might transmigrate into a cat next time to scare people.
meanings.sent4: The idea of souls that transmigrate into animals is a fascinating concept.
meanings.sent5: The thought of a loved one's spirit transmigrating into a butterfly brought comfort to the grieving family.
